snippet: William Goetzee, a Coast Guard officer in New Orleans whose life was intertwined with the city’s ordeals, committed suicide in 2011 in the notorious Orleans Parish Prison.
abstract: Suicide of Coast Guard Commander William Goetzee in the Orleans Parish Prison in New Orleans in 2011 is at the center of a Justice Department investigation into conditions at the prison; federal officials have given Sheriff Marlin N Gusman, who runs the jail, and the city, which pays for most of it, a matter of weeks to agree to reforms or face a federal lawsuit.
lead_paragraph: William Goetzee, a Coast Guard officer in New Orleans whose life was intertwined with the city’s ordeals, committed suicide in 2011 in the notorious Orleans Parish Prison.

headline.seo: A Life Buffeted by New Orleans’s Ordeals Ends in a Troubled Jail
headline.main: A Suicide in a Troubled Jail Mirrors New Orleans’s Ordeals
headline.print_headline: A Suicide in a Troubled Jail Mirrors New Orleans’s Ordeals
